Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Adventure111
Reviews.Content: Public transportation is a block away. The airport bus stops a block away. Quiet area with Prada store at the end of the street! Yet the hotel is inexpensive. Our room was quiet, huge, neat as a pin. The full breakfast is included and car parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidDavid1111
Reviews.Content: Relatively small hotel but rooms were very spacious. Despite being old, the rooms were well maintained. Location of hotel is in the main 'high class' shopping street in West Berlin. Metro (U-Bahn) station is around 10 minutes walk away along the main street which line all the famous brands. LV is just opposite the road. Great location and very safe!! Hotel staff was friendly and offered directions and help on where to go - take bus 100 and 200 which is similar to the city sightseeing route Was there to celebrate the new year and hotel staff sent an email beforehand to check my arrival time as reception will not be manned on the night of new year's eve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DanielK-5780
Reviews.Content: Great location along Kufurstendamm. Staff friendly, room tidy. Only minus is the bathroom: pipes in the toilet make an incredible noise.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: BIALGW
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mainly due to a previous stay around 1996. This time I stayed for 4 nights between 15th and 19th December and paid 150 Euros which included breakfast. The hotel occupies 2 floors, the second and fourth, within a typical European building. You have to ring the door bell to gain access, then take the quaint old wooden lift to the second floor for the reception area. I arrived at the hotel early but I was able to check in immediately with the minimum of fuss. The reception staff were friendly and eager to help with information, maps, tickets etc. I was given room number one on the 4th floor. I was given 2 keys; one for the door at street level and the other which opened both my room and the door to the 4th floor; this made me wonder whether all the rooms could be opened with the same key. Despite this possible security issue I felt safe within the hotel. The room was clean but could do with being painted. It was quite large with a desk, 2 chairs, a couple of bedside tables and a wardrobe. I had booked a single room but this one was set up as a double with 2 single matresses contained within a double bed frame; but only a single duvet was provided. There was also a small television with lots of German channels; the only non German channel I found was CNN. The bathroom was OK but I found the 6 inch step from the main bedroom into the bathroom and then another large step up into the shower to be a bit unnecessary. I also discovered that I had to let the water run for 4 or 5 minutes before it became hot. Breakfast was served in a large room on the 4th floor. It the usual European fayre; breads, cold meats, cheeses, pickles, eggs, yoghurts, fruit, cereal, coffee,tea and fruit juice. The hotel is located on a side street about 20 yards from Kurfurstendamm with all its shops and transport connections. It is conveniently situated for the bus from Tegel airport but is less convenient for most tourist sights however these can be easily reached by public transport. The hotel is clean on the surface but when looked at a bit closer it is clear that the whole building could do with rennovation. I would however still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise next to Prada shop”
Reviews.Author: Andrej_Bee
Reviews.Content: We were 5 in a hotel suite for a really reasonable price only 5min from U-Bahn. The hotel room was clean, spacious and we had also a terrace outside that we found out only after 1 day. It has a kitchen, but with no pans or anything. Around the hotel are a lot of good and not expensive restaurants and bars, and expensive Prada and Rolex shops. Money well spent for this housing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great staff in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Deb B
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Pension Kima around 9pm, took the charming, yet tiny elevator to the reception floor and were kindly greeted. Check in was quick and minimal. The man at the reception (forgot his name, but he was super friendly and very cute!) gave us some tips for where we could grab late night dinner in the area. The room was very clean and spacious for the price (I believe around 70 euros). Beds were comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was varied and delicious- breads, meats, cheeses, juices, tomatoes, pickles! Check out was just as easy as check in. Highly recommend- was so pleasantly surprised by our treatment at Pension Kima! Oh, and it is in such a wonderful location- shops and shopping mile right outside your door!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: BoogieChillen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kima is located in a very nice section of West Berlin. For instance Louis Vuitton is less than a block away. However, and more important than Louis Vuitton, is that you can conveniently catch the bus or the train and quickly be anywhere in Berlin. If you walk a block or two west on Kurfurstendamm there is a bus stop that includes a ticket machine so you can purchase your ticket before getting on the bus. Also, the Savignyplatz S-bahn is only a 10 minute walk. The hotel itself was only average, but the rooms were clean and comfortable. We also found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. On our way out of the hotel our first morning in Berlin we stopped by reception to ask a few questions and the person working that morning was great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value near Ku'dam”
Reviews.Author: mrbi0
Reviews.Content: Large room, very clean, basic German breakfast, but great location, just off the Ku'dam. Easy bus connection to Tegel airport. Best part was the price.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful hotel staff and good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rngogreen
Reviews.Content: It was a quick 5min walk away from the Metero. Hotel staff were friendly, and when we first got to the hotel, the man working at the front desk inquired if we were first timers to Berlin, and then spent the next 10min telling us where to go, how to get there, and wrote details on a map he gave us. He was extremely helpful and made our first impression of this hotel great. Plus the free breakfast was good with cold meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs, rolls, cereal, coffee, and tea. Our room was also huge and the area around the hotel was quiet, so we were able to keep the windows open at night.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location, unfortunately I can only weakly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lil_drama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days / 3 nights recently. Many pros and cons. Location: In West Germany's traditional shopping district. If you're like me, and prefer to spend more on shopping than hotels, this is a perfect location. On a side street off Ku'damm, so you've got Hublot, Louis Vuitton, Valentino on the block. Even a Prada-in-process right next door to the hotel. Public Transportation: The 109 bus stops a block away, providing a direct line (~25 minutes) to Tegel Airport. In the other direction, the 109 will take you (<10 minutes) to the Bahnhof Zoo, from which you can get just about any bus, S-Bahn or U-Bahn, including the much-loved 100 and 200 cross-town busses. Other busses that stop one block from the hotel include the M19 and M29, which (among other places) go directly past the KaDeWe. Elevator: Small old-fashioned lift, worked fine when I was there. WiFi: Available at 1 euro per hour. You pay at the front desk and get a password (in 1 hour increments). Pretty reliable in the time I was there. Breakfast: When I booked and checked in, the hotel indicated breakfast was included in the price. However, on my bill checking out, it is listed separately at 5 euro per day. This did not increase my room price, instead the room price listed was 5 euro less. Unfortunately, I never quite got up early enough to try the breakfast -- it was served from 7:30-10am. Passed by the breakfast room frequently, though, and it looked quite spacious and very nice. Rooms: I booked a single, was given a "double" bed (2 twin mattresses inside a double frame with a double sheet). Of course, this means you need to beware of sleeping on that middle crease. Aside from the bed, there was a fairly nice armoire with full-length mirror (nice addition), small television (over 2 dozen channels -- 1 in French, a BBC, CNN, and the rest German), small desk and chair, and en suite bathroom with toilet and shower. There are some rooms without en suites, as I saw the communal shower and WC in the hallway; these looked clean but creepy and I'm glad I did not have to use. Drapes were very thin and did not cover over entire window; because the building is shaped like a courtyard, I was in the awkward position of trying to avoid being seen by the across-the-way neighbors through the window. The room has 2 radiators and in theory you could adjust the heat, but in my 3 nights there I was never able to get it very warm. The duvet provided was sufficient, however. Service: Friendly front desk staff. I arrived around 11am (4 hours before check-in), and was given a room right away. Spoke good (not perfect) English, without my having to ask gave me maps and pointed out how to get to various suggested locations. Stored my luggage securely in the office the day I checked out. Housekeeping was not so friendly and spoke limited English. I mostly think I was bothering them by leaving each day so early (they wanted to get into the room and do their jobs). Building: I had never stayed in a Pension before. This is basically 3 floors of a larger building that has residences and offices. When you arrive, you need to ring the Hotel buzzer to gain access to the building, then take the lift up to the 2nd floor to reception. My room was on the 4th floor. You are given 2 keys -- one for the building and the other for your room. Despite the issues with the window (see above), I felt perfectly safe in the hotel. So, if you've read this far ... would I stay here again, or recommend to a friend? Perhaps, if other accommodations were not available or too pricey. The specific deal-breaker cons: - No hot water. I tried, honestly I did, but I never could get the water in either the sink or shower to get above tepid. This was regardless of the time (even waking at 6:00am to beat the rush). - Hard beds. So this is not news for Europe, but for some reason these were extraordinarily hard. Maybe it's just coincidence, but I woke up the first morning with a tremendous backache that only got worse each night. I am positive it is because of the bed. - Sour experience during checkout. I mentioned that the reception staff is friendly, and for the most part I was pleased. However, during check out, the front desk agent purposely withheld my change (a minor amount, 6 euro), but it really rubbed me the wrong way. He gave me the bill for 94 euro and when I paid with 100 euro cash, he simply took it and turned away, not even given the pretense that he would get me change. Like I said, it was a minor amount, but it rubbed me the wrong way, especially when combined with the bill itself which made it seem that breakfast (which I did not have on any day) was a separate charge. If you can overlook those last 3 issues, I think Hotel Kima Pension is a fine place to stay, and definitely a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Karleriksen
Reviews.Content: I was forced to cancel my stay with this hotel due to unforeseen events at work. Usually, in this busy world, a hotel understands the need to cancel, and would like to welcome customers back. But I had the same experience as the other reviewer on this site: the hotel started sending me emails with increasingly harsh threats of legal sanctions, besides these mood-draining email spams they found my private phone number and called me up at work threatening me. I have now decided to pay the amount for a service never received nor provided to end this nightmare - but I wouldn't recommend doing business with this hotel to anyone. I am still wondering what they would have come up with next.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, basic rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Vic1010
Reviews.Content: We had booked a quad room and ended up with a strange ground floor 2 bed appt with a non functioning kitchen. Basic furnishings/decor but it was clean and tidy. The breakfast was ok - the usual continental breads/ham/cheeses etc. The location was excellent - only a few yards away from the main shopping street with Chanel, Gucci, YSL on the doorstep. Reception staff varied from the very friendly and helpful to the grumpy type that glares at you when you dare to ask a question. For the price it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastische!”
Reviews.Author: babzvz
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here last week for five nights. The staff were fantastic: helpful, friendly, really welcoming. The room was spotless and the bathroom really spacious. The breakfast was yummy. I recommend it really highly; it's excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super service”
Reviews.Author: michaelvdm
Reviews.Content: Loved the old feel, coziness of the rooms and retro elevator. The owner is a really nice guy, VERY helpfull and friendly. Gave us some good tips for dining, transport, drinking such as Cafe Clo which was hilarious! Rooms are big and clean, breakfast is ok, not a lot of choice but correct. It has a great location for shopping, it's at the Kurfürstendamm.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of doing business with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jonwald
Reviews.Content: I had a dispute with the Hotel Kima when I cancelled a booking. We each had different interpretations of the cancellation terms. I cancelled at a date where I believed I should not have been charged; the hotel thought I was liable to pay for the full rate because of a special exemption period. Regardless of who was right or wrong, the hotel approached the whole dispute in a way which was rigid and extremely unhelpful. Clearly the Hotel Kima does not believe that "the customer is always right"; they seem to feel, at least in my case, that the customer's views should not be considered at all. Over the course of the dispute, they repeatedly refused to address the multiple specific issues I raised about contradictions in the cancellation terms; offered no compromises or suggestions of ways to resolve the dispute; did not acknowledge or respond to a compromise I proposed; and even suggested they could charge me full price for a night which fell outside the special exemption period. They made no concession to the idea that I might in any way be justified in my interpretation, instead implying that I was obtuse (they said 99% of their customers understand their terms). When I decided to dispute the charge with my credit card company and ultimately post my story here, they accused me of not fairly representing their views, even though I had repeatedly tried to see things from their perspective: in the end in fact, as I told them, I understood why they believed in their interpretation of the terms - but I also felt strongly that the terms were contradictory and that my interpretation was absolutely justified. Their response was to repeat over and over that the terms were clear, and then accuse me of being intransigent. I recommend avoiding any place that has this sort of attitude.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ulpu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted to stay near Charlottensburg and this hotel had got good reviews in Tripadvisor. Eventhough I had read the positive reviews, I didn't expect too much because of the low prices. However once we got to the hotel, I was pleasently suprised! The hotel is a bit worn but in a charming way. The room (number 20) was spacious and cozy. The bathroom was clean, although a bit small. The only downside I can think of is that the walls aren't very thick so you might hear your neigbour talking and the rooms do get a bit warm during hot, sunny days. During our stay in Berlin, the temperatures were around +34 C and we had to sleep our windows open. Luckily the windows opened towards the backyard so there weren't any bothering noices from the street. Breakfast (continental) was good for the price you paid. Staff, especially the man in the reception, was nice and extremely helpful. He can give you good tips about public transport, nearby restaurants etc. All in all, if you are not looking for anything fancy and luxurious but a nice and comfortable hotel during your stay in Berlin, I warmly recommend Hotel Kima.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location and good value”
Reviews.Author: john_ivycottage
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of the action look elsewhere in Berlin. But if you want reasonably priced accommodation in a good area a few minutes bus ride from all the sights, Hotel Kima has a lot going for it. It occupies three floors of a turn of the century appartment house just off Kurfurstendamm near Olivaer Platz. An antique lift takes you to the reception on the second floor. Our room on the first floor was reached by the back stairs. Breakfast was served on the fourth floor (accessed by the lift). I would imagine all the rooms are different, being divisions of the original appartments. Ours was typically high-ceilinged and a reasonable size although sparsely furnished. The mattress was quite firm. The shower room was small but perfectly adequate. Everything worked but it all looked a little tired. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and of reasonable quality. The man usually on reception was well-informed and very obliging.

Reviews.Title: “At the corner of kurfurstendam”
Reviews.Author: viking0
Reviews.Content: Old fashion style Berlin building - with the hotel at 1. floor. This is a great location - but and average hotel. Our Room 26 was a very small with two hard low beds. A good bathroom made the room a descent place to stay in berlin. windue to a smallcourtyard and a firestair down to quiet yard. Some rooms are big and great value at hotel Kima - other small and cheap. All in all it was a good deal with only 98 E for fri/saturday in centrum Berlin incl a standard breakfast - made it value 4. The area where Kotel Kima lies > Charlottenburg is great green walking paradise for a curiuos tourist. Many small restaurent and outside tavernas and bars are spread around Charlottenburg with highlights at savigny platz with is great spot for a dinner, a coffebreak or just a relax walk - scwarze cafe is open 24 hours close by at kantstrasse - and you can walk out and enjoy home-brewed beers and German cuisine in BerlinŽs oldest brewery tavern. Located opposite to Charlottenburg Palace.. with is like being in paris if the sun shines.. check it here : http://www.brauhaus-lemke.com/index_3.html if you want to go back to burges and fries good old Fonzie times.. try The Route 66 Diner in Pariser Street 44 in Berlin-Wilmersdorf near Kurfürstendamm - experience the golden age of america. I been many time in berlin and i always stay in the charlottenbrug barrio* its green, decadent and a wonderful place to wake up - close to the best shopping - will recommend mark apartment in litzenburger for a longer stay or a if you are familie or more persons. But for backpackers, budget travelles or for shorts stays - Hotel Kima is not bad at all. (but dont ask for room 26 :-) .

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, cannot recommed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larsa
Reviews.Content: For my recent trip to Berlin over Easter, I chose this hotel based on the numerous positive Tripadvisor reviews. However, I was quite disappointed. My single room looked more like a drab cell than a hotel room, I hated the wall- to-wall carpet, no shower gel or shampoo was provided, and the mattress in the narrow bed was hard and lumpy. Worst of all: every time other guests would pass my room in the adjacent corridor it sounded like a herd of elephants - very noisy! It would also happen that other guests and/or staff members would smoke by the front desk, which wasn't far from my room (#23), whereby the disgusting smell of cigarette smoke would creep into my (non-smoking) room. The location really isn't that great either. Although the hotel is right by the Kurfürstendamm with its exclusive shops, it is quite far from Berlin's major attractions. For this reason, during my visit, I found myself either waiting for a bus or on a bus most of the time. If I go back to Berlin, I will definitely pick a hotel closer to Mitte or Unter den Linden, which is far more convenient from the perspective of a tourist. The one positive thing I have to say about this hotel is that the male front desk clerk who seemed to be on duty most of the time was very helpful in giving me directions and hints. (The rest of the staff hardly spoke English at all)

Reviews.Title: “Top value for money in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Hilde43
Reviews.Content: Hotel isn't much to look at, entrance hall is dated and the lift seemed dodgy (but worked ok) but as the saying goes; don't judge a book by its cover. This hotel is excellent and had all we needed for our 5 night stay in Berlin. Spotlessly clean room with ensuite newly renovated, comfortable bed, very quiet, excellent breakfast included in the very reasonable price. Guy on the front desk is very friendly and speaks good english. Hotel is very well located, just of the Ku'damm and easy walk to public transport. If staying somewhere that has the latest modern trendy decour is important to you, then don't stay here. If you want excellent accomodation, top service & good value for money, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “very cheap, typical Berlin building, good breakfast and excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: somoslagente
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this pension with my little girl. It was very good value for money and the receptionist had a map and LOTS and LOTS of information ready for us when we arrived - even though we were only staying one night and had paid very little for it. The hotel is up several floors and you need to take an old fashihoned lift to get there (was hard trying to get myself, my luggage and my little girl in her buggy in the lift - but we managed in the end). The rooms are on a different floor to the reception - so when u book in you will probably have to get back into the lift and go up to the next floor. Our room didn't have a bath or a shower or WC - but these were just across the landing. The room had a wash hand basin and a mirror, a t.v., reading light, wardrobe and a bed. It was VERY VERY clean and I would stay here again if I was back in Berlin. The breakfast in the morning was VERY GOOD. Typically German and lots of choice. It is a buffet service. They also had a high-chair for my little girl and all the local newspapers to read whilst you are eating. It was a very friendly breakfast atmosphere and there were guests from all backgrounds staying there whilst we were there. You can have cereal, toast, tea, coffee and cheese, bread, ham and jam etc. eat as much as you like. The hotel was just off the K Damm - where there are lots of shops etc. It is just beside a few different bus stops that take you all over the city and there is a metro station nearby too. [--] The building that the pension is located in is very elegant. there is also a lovely traditional german toyshop across the road and a tapas bar just down stairs

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, clean, quaint and well located”
Reviews.Author: Rudsy
Reviews.Content: Very helpful man in reception who helped us with orientation before we had even asked. Hot water was turned off in the afternoon which was a pain, but it didn't seem to be a regular occurance. Bed was a bit unauthordox, two singles combined into a double with strange pillows but it was comfy enough. Room was big and comfortable. Location was good, a bit away from the attractions in the east but surrounded by nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: i8blades
Reviews.Content: The size of the room is unbelieveable,massive.You would think that the size of the room would make it difficult to keep it warm but when we there the temp dropped to -11 & -12 on a couple of days but we actually had to turn down the radiator at night because it was just too hot. Nothing was too much trouble for the reception staff,allways on hand with info on the buses etc(offer on while we were there,buy a single ticket,and you could use it as a day ticket.) The breakfast was very good,with plenty of choice,allthough the coffee is a bit weak but no complaint there. we would deffinately stay there again,very good value for money. There is a nice irish bar nearby (found it by accident)....turn left on Ku Damm,then right at the next junction and its 5 min walk.its a lot cheaper than the one in the europer center. ps my wife loved the authentisity of the lift

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: anchel79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kima is a fantastic hotel central to Berlin. Our room was large, clean and bright. There was a wardrobe, desk and Television. The beds were very comfortable and the room was amazingly quiet. The hotel is in a great location, a short bus ride from Zoologischer Garten station. The surrounding area is a incredible shopping district with premium brands like Burberry, Rolex and Bvulgari. The check-in desk staff were lovely and very helpful in planning our sightseeing, providing advice on what to see and transport. They provide a traditional continental breakfast of cold meat, cheeses, cereal, tea, coffee and juice. Quite a good spread when compared to what I have received in similar Pensions across Europe. The only negative about the hotel was the cold. We stayed in a very cold snap and for some reason the heating wasn't on. It eventually came on in the morning around 10 am - just as we were leaving for the day sightseeing! My advice is that if you do stay in during colder weather to make sure you have warm PJ's! A great place to stay in Berlin, and is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missithompson
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem. From the moment we got there we felt comfortable and at ease. A very friendly chap at front desk instantly produced a map for us and marked various points of interest on there as well as explaining about travel across the city and best ways to get around. Breakfast was great. Room was lovely and clean and warm. All in all a charming experience.

Reviews.Title: “great choise!!!”
Reviews.Author: ayait
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week. the room was big and comfortable. breakfast was very nice according to Europe standards. price- more then reasonable. the 2 best things was the service and the location. location- a minute from the main street (ku- damm), close to all kinds of public transportation. service- great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JonesC
Reviews.Content: I love a bargain and Kima Hotel is THE bargain hotel in Berlin. Bus 109 from Tegel goes to Olivaer Platz and then it's about 3 blocks down the Ku'damm (head in the direction of the memorial church) and right on Wielandstr. For the price (45 Euros a single, with breakfast and private bath) you won't find luxury. But it is clean, safe, has a tv, a lift (reception is on the 2nd floor; rooms on the 4th). The breakfast is extensive, the coffee is good. And the staff is very nice and helpful. I only spoke German with them, but they do speak English, too. It is also about 4-5 blocks from the Adenauer U-Bahn. I also had a room in the back and so there was no street noise at all. You do have to sign up for internet and while the connection is good, it's not a great deal. But that was the only drawback. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler62
Reviews.Content: There is nothing fancy about this hotel. It lacks frills, good looks, and a nice lobby to sit in. On the other hand, what they do, they do extremely well, and you can't beat it for the money. It is clean, the rooms are quiet and spacious (I had one of the smallest rooms and it was bigger than some that cost five times as much!) the ample breakfast buffet is included in the price and the people at the desk are very friendly and very helpful. It is in a fabulous location, 1/2 block off the Kurfurstendamm but on a quiet side street. Surrounded with public transportation, restaurants, bars, shops etc. The #109 Bus to Tegel leaves every ten minutes from across the street, takes 20 minutes and costs EU 2.90. There is a ticket machine at the bus stop. Outstanding value for the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location!”
Reviews.Author: mcurs24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend and really enjoyed my stay! Kima has a great central location, in a quiet side road just off Ku'damm! It is located in a stylish early 20th century building that comes with squeeking stairs and a lift that is as old as the building (an experience on its own) but no worries it operates just fine. My room was very clean, bright with a view to the backyard. I had opted for shared bathroom and that worked fine for me as all shared ameneties were in proper and clean condition. Their Breakfast buffet is decent and they have great coffee. Reception was very friendly, attentive and helpful. To sum up, great value for money and location! Can absolutey recommend it and hope to be back there soon. 'Ich bin ein Berliner' :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Pension”
Reviews.Author: RAFpolizei
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and encountered no problems at all. I found staff here when I arrived at 2345hrs. Staff were also here when I fancied a beer at 0100 (Kindle or Becks). Breakfast was the usual rolls, meats, cheese, jams and cereals but there were hot boiled eggs as well. I like my coffee with muscles on and I was not disappointed either. I have used elevators in many parts of the world but never seen one like the Kima's - its not a moan because the thing worked perfectly! I found everything clean, a comfy if firm bed, plumbing worked well. OK the window frames need a lick of paint but I wasn't there for the decor. I think the building escaped a lot of damage when the city was flattened in WW2 as a lot of it seems original 1800s. My umpteenth visit to Berlin and another pleasant stay though not come across this Pension before which was a late substitution for me.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but make sure your lock works”
Reviews.Author: carlhollywood
Reviews.Content: It's a great location and the people are very nice. But one night I tried to unlock the door to my room and it didn't work. I tried several times, then reluctantly looked around for a way to contact the manager. There's no staff at the front desk at night, but there is someone elsewhere in the building. I contacted her, and she came downstairs, tried the lock, and confirmed it was broken. Then she called someone who appeared to be the manager and handed me the phone. The manager said I'd have to stay in a different room that night without my bags, but fortunately the person on duty found a locksmith who broke the lock so I could move myself and my bags to a different room. Nobody's fault really - things break sometimes. Still, part of the reason this place is cheap is that it's unstaffed at night, so if you encounter any problems be prepared to wait an hour or two before you find a solution. You might want to take your contact holder and solution with you when you go outside, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience, clean, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: indianguy
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is situated close to the Zoologischer Garten which is like the tourist hub of Berlin. The directions provided on on the booking site about how to reach the hotel were excellent and we reached the hotel without any difficulty. The breakfast is of excellent quality and quite sufficient. Going anywhere is not a problem at all as it is only 3 stops away from the S-Bahn at Zoologischer Garten. The public transport system in Berlin is excellent and affordable especially with the Berlin Welcome Card or day tickets. The rooms are small but scrupulously clean and the bathrooms clean and functional. The people managing the reception desk are truly wonderful with suggestions, maps and directions. All in all, a very pleasurable experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazzieDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money in a very safe area, stayed there for four nights and were out quite late yet felt totally safe. The receptionist was extremely helpful with maps, information etc. The building is very old but the room was modern, clean, warm and very quiet at night. Its only a short walk to the nearest bus stop and public transport is excellent in Berlin and very easy to use even if you don't know any German. Bus 100 and 200 will take you to most of the sights at a fraction of the cost of a sightseeing bus. There was plenty of hot water and towels were changed every day, there was a good choice of bread, cereal, cheese and meat for breakfast and there was also a toaster. Berlin is a great city to visit especially when the Christmas markets are on and i would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good for back-packers”
Reviews.Author: pen-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights. As everybody writes, personal is very friendly and helpful. Room is small but clean. What I did not like were location, noisy toilet and towel change. Pension is located little bit far away from the city center. It is possible to reach everywhere by bus easily but there is not so many restaurants around pension. I was bit scared walking this area alone at night to look for eating possibilities. Quite dark streets, not so many people etc... Because of very old building, water system in the bathroom is not nice. Everything works fine, but they installed pumps for used water. Everytime I use water or toilet, pump starts working and makes loud noise. About towel, they did not change towels during my stay at all. I am sure they will replace if I ask, but I expect such standard service automatically. I think this pension is suitable for back-packer or young students.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect "cheap and cheerful" pension”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, reasonably priced and scrupulously clean. The Hotel Kima is located on the second and fourth floors of an 1890s Beaux Arts building just off of Kurfürstendamm, in an area full of lively cafes and designer shops. Our room, number 14, was simple, but the bedding, furniture and bathroom fixtures were all new. The shower was hot with good water pressure. We felt welcome: the staff even found me a sweater to wear when the weather suddenly turned cold. Breakfast was included, and was good if unspectacular: fresh brötchen, cheese, ham, smoked salmon, yoghurt, juice, tea and coffee, fruit. I will and have recommended this hotel to friends planning to visit Berlin. It's not the Hilton: the rooms are small, despite their 20-foot ceilings. But you're looking for a friendly, modest base for exploring this great city, it'll do just fine. Note to parents of small children: Hotel Kima is child-friendly and - at least in room 14 - child-proofed. Small strollers will fit in the elevator, and there is a mini-playground at the end of the block. Shops in this area - like most of Germany - are shut tight on Sunday and public holidays, so make sure to buy diapers, fruit snacks etc. the day before.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Porti
Reviews.Content: We are 5 Spaniards who spent 5 days in Berlin the last week of September (for Marathon reasons) and we all want to recomend this hotel to everybody. The situation of this warm hotel is fantastic, you have the train station very close and it is placed in the most commercial and exclusive part of the city. All type of restaurans, shops, and services are really accessible on foot. The big rooms are really comfortable and what it is most important they are clean and tidy. But the most important thing to take into account for choosing this hotel is the people who works there. We have had an incredible service and all along our stay we received unexpected attentions which we really appreciate very much. Thanks to the owner, receptionis and everybody for being like this and make our stay in Berlin really fantastic. I think if I come back there, I´ll choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sarabc99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a very quiet street right in the heart of upscale shopping. It was actually located in one of the few areas of Berlin that were not completely covered by graffiti! The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated and an excellent breakfast buffet was included with the price. There were bus stops located just down the street from the hotel, making it very easy to get around Berlin. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kima pension hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The kima pension hotel, it's very nice cleaner rooms and frendly atmosfere,i spend a lovely week end at the beginning of february in this wonderfull city and nice hotel, Aldo from Rome
